verses.text: If there be a controversy between men , and they come unto judgment , that \add the judges\add* may judge them; then they shall justify the righteous , and condemn the wicked.
And it shall be, if the wicked man \add be\add* worthy to be beaten , that the judge shall cause him to lie down , and to be beaten before his face , according to his fault , by a certain number.
Forty stripes he may give him, \add and\add* not exceed : lest, \add if\add* he should exceed , and beat him above these with many stripes , then thy brother should seem vile unto thee. \p
¶ Thou shalt not muzzle the ox when he treadeth out \add the corn\add*.\f + \fr 25.4 \ft treadeth…: Heb. thresheth\f* \p

¶ If brethren dwell together , and one of them die , and have no child , the wife of the dead shall not marry without unto a stranger : her husband’s brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to wife , and perform the duty of an husband’s brother unto her.\f + \fr 25.5 \ft her husband’s…: or, her next kinsman\f*
And it shall be, \add that\add* the firstborn which she beareth shall succeed in the name of his brother \add which is\add* dead , that his name be not put out of Israel.

And if the man like not to take his brother’s wife , then let his brother’s wife go up to the gate unto the elders , and say , My husband’s brother refuseth to raise up unto his brother a name in Israel , he will not perform the duty of my husband’s brother.\f + \fr 25.7 \ft brother’s: or, next kinsman’s\f*
Then the elders of his city shall call him, and speak unto him: and \add if\add* he stand \add to it\add*, and say , I like not to take her;

Then shall his brother’s wife come unto him in the presence of the elders , and loose his shoe from off his foot , and spit in his face , and shall answer and say , So shall it be done unto that man that will not build up his brother’s house.
And his name shall be called in Israel , The house of him that hath his shoe loosed. \p

¶ When men strive together one with another , and the wife of the one draweth near for to deliver her husband out of the hand of him that smiteth him, and putteth forth her hand , and taketh him by the secrets :
Then thou shalt cut off her hand , thine eye shall not pity \add her\add*. \p
¶ Thou shalt not have in thy bag divers weights , a great and a small.\f + \fr 25.13 \ft divers…: Heb. a stone and a stone\f*
Thou shalt not have in thine house divers measures , a great and a small.\f + \fr 25.14 \ft divers…: Heb. an ephah and an ephah\f*

\add But\add* thou shalt have a perfect and just weight , a perfect and just measure shalt thou have: that thy days may be lengthened in the land which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God giveth thee.
For all that do such things , \add and\add* all that do unrighteously , \add are\add* an abomination unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God. \p
¶ Remember what Amalek did unto thee by the way , when ye were come forth out of Egypt ;
How he met thee by the way , and smote the hindmost of thee, \add even\add* all \add that were\add* feeble behind thee, when thou \add wast\add* faint and weary ; and he feared not God.

Therefore it shall be, when the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God hath given thee rest from all thine enemies round about , in the land which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God giveth thee \add for\add* an inheritance to possess it, \add that\add* thou shalt blot out the remembrance of Amalek from under heaven ; thou shalt not forget \add it\add*.
